intro: Cuphea spermacoce var. elongata, commonly known as the long-seed cuphea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Lythraceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant produces small, elongated seeds enclosed in a capsule, which contributes to its common name. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for garden cultivation. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its vibrant blooms and unique seed structure.
